articles.title: Trump administration demands states ‘undo’ full SNAP payouts as states warn of ‘catastrophic impact’
articles.description:
If Trump attempts to claw back the money, “we will see him in court," Governor Maura Healey said.

The post Trump administration demands states ‘undo’ full SNAP payouts as states warn of ‘catastrophic impact’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Governor Maura Healey vows to fight Trump administration's SNAP payout rollback in court.
States warn that undoing full SNAP payouts could lead to catastrophic impacts on residents.
Boston residents may face increased food insecurity if SNAP funding is reduced.

articles.title: Donald Trump plans to be the 1st sitting US president at a regular-season NFL game since 1978
articles.description:
Only two other times did a president go to an NFL game during the regular season while in office, according to the league: Richard Nixon in 1969 and Jimmy Carter in 1978.

The post Donald Trump plans to be the 1st sitting US president at a regular-season NFL game since 1978 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Donald Trump will attend an NFL game, marking a historic first since 1978.
Only two presidents previously attended regular-season NFL games: Nixon in 1969 and Carter in 1978.
Boston residents may see increased security and attention during the game due to Trump's presence.

articles.title: MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors
articles.description:
Ortiz was arrested by the FBI on Sunday morning at Boston Logan International Airport. He is expected to appear in federal court in Boston on Monday.

The post MLB pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz charged with taking bribes to rig pitches for bettors appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Luis Ortiz was arrested at Boston Logan International Airport on November 5.
Ortiz is expected to appear in federal court in Boston on November 6.
Charges may impact local sports betting regulations and MLB's integrity in Boston.

articles.title: Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner of 17 years who led an era of riches and expansion, dies at 84
articles.description:
Tagliabue was commissioner after Pete Rozelle from 1989 to 2006.

The post Paul Tagliabue, NFL commissioner of 17 years who led an era of riches and expansion, dies at 84 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Paul Tagliabue, former NFL commissioner, died at 84 on November 9, 2023.
He served as commissioner from 1989 to 2006, overseeing NFL expansion.
His leadership influenced local sports culture and economic growth in Boston.
